explanation: Lupus erythematosus is a systemic autoimmune disease that can cause a wide range of symptoms, including panniculitis (inflammation of the fatty layer under the skin), peripheral neuropathy (damage to the nerves in the extremities), nasal ulcers, lichen planus (an inflammatory skin condition), and delirium (a sudden disturbance in mental state).}, {diagnosis: Wegeners granulomatosis (granulomatosis with polyangiitis)

explanation: Wegeners granulomatosis is a rare autoimmune disease that causes inflammation of blood vessels. It can affect various organs, including the skin, nervous system, and respiratory tract, leading to symptoms such as panniculitis, peripheral neuropathy, nasal ulcers, and delirium.}, {diagnosis: Churg-Strauss syndrome (eosinophilic granulomatosis with polyangiitis)

explanation: Churg-Strauss syndrome is a rare disorder that causes inflammation of small arteries. It often affects the lungs, skin, and nerves, potentially causing symptoms like panniculitis, peripheral neuropathy, nasal ulcers, and delirium.}, {diagnosis: Polyarteritis nodosa

explanation: Polyarteritis nodosa is a systemic vasculitis that affects medium-sized arteries. It can cause inflammation in various organs, leading to symptoms such as panniculitis, peripheral neuropathy, and delirium.}, {diagnosis: Sarcoidosis

explanation: Sarcoidosis is an inflammatory disease that affects multiple organs, most commonly the lungs, skin, and lymph nodes. It can cause a wide range of symptoms, including panniculitis, peripheral neuropathy, and delirium.}, {diagnosis: Behcets disease

explanation: Behcets disease is a rare immune-mediated disorder that causes inflammation of blood vessels throughout the body. It can cause a variety of symptoms, including oral and genital ulcers, skin lesions, and neurological problems like peripheral neuropathy.}, {diagnosis: Infections (e.g., tuberculosis, syphilis)

explanation: Certain infections, like tuberculosis and syphilis, can cause a wide range of symptoms throughout the body, including panniculitis, peripheral neuropathy, nasal ulcers, and delirium.}, {diagnosis: Drug reactions
explanation: Certain medications can cause a wide range of side effects, including panniculitis, peripheral neuropathy, lichen planus, and delirium.}, {diagnosis: Paraneoplastic syndromes

explanation: Paraneoplastic syndromes are a group of rare disorders that occur when the immune system reacts to cancer in the body, leading to damage in other organs. This can cause a variety of neurological and skin-related symptoms.}, {diagnosis: Cryoglobulinemia

explanation: Cryoglobulinemia is a condition characterized by the presence of abnormal proteins in the blood that can clump together in cold temperatures. This can cause inflammation in blood vessels and tissues, leading to symptoms such as panniculitis, peripheral neuropathy, and skin ulcers.}
